It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its compact, low-growing form with dense clusters of small, violet-blue flowers. Its leaves are typically succulent, adapted to store water in its native dry environment. Steinchisma spathellosum thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in rocky outcrops or along coastal dunes.
